caption: Figure 1
alt: This diagram shows the bones of the upper arm and the elbow joint. The left panel shows the anterior view, and the right panel shows the posterior view.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 2
alt: This figure shows the bones of the lower arm.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 3
alt: This figure shows the bones in the hand and wrist joints. The left panel shows the anterior view, and the right panel shows the posterior view.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 4
alt: This image shows a radiograph of a human hand.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 5
alt: This figure shows a hand and a cross-section image of the nerves at the wrist.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 6
alt: The left panel of this figure shows a hand gripping a motorcycle handle loosely, and the right panel shows a hand gripping a motorcycle handle tightly.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0

caption: Figure 7
alt: The top panel of this figure shows the different types of fracture in the humerus, and the bottom panel shows the different types of fracture in the radius.
credit: OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e, CC BY 4.0
